be.ephec.othello.models

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ephec.othello.models.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Main logic class, this class handle things like moves, flipping pawns, check if a move is possible...
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    David Micciche and Adrien Culem

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Main constructor, start with an initial board where the center pawns are already set.
      Board(Pawn[][] board)
      Constructor from a already given board (might be used for loading a save for instance).

      • isInGrid

        public boolean isInGrid(int row,
                        int col)
        This method check whether a coordinate is inside the board or not, prevent OutOfBound error.
        Parameters:
        row, - x axis
        col, - y axis
        Returns:
        true if a case is in the board, return false if not

      • isAdjacentToOppositePawnColor

        public boolean[] isAdjacentToOppositePawnColor(int row,
                                               int col,
                                               Pawn currentPawnColor)
        This method check whether a case has opposite pawns beside it. If it does, set its coordinate to true (to utilise alongside the arrays of direction).
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        currentPawnColor, - color of current player
        Returns:
        boolean[] arrayOfDirection where true is the direction of a pawn of different color direcly siding it. false if not format : 0 1 2 3 X 4 5 6 7

      • isPossibleMove

        public boolean isPossibleMove(int row,
                              int col,
                              Pawn currentPawnColor)
        This method check if you can put a pawn in a given coordinate by looking on the offset of a direction and meeting the right criteria
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        currentPawnColor -
        Returns:
        true if you can put a pawn in the coordinate
